block.p: Seeking a Return to Normal At Virginia Tech, students and teachers prepared to return to class today. At Korean-American churches, congregants reflected on the fact that a Korean student had killed 32 people last week.
PAGE A14
Rethinking a Plea Deal In 2002, John Walker Lindh, who served as a Taliban soldier, made a deal to serve 20 years in prison. Today, the deal does not look as good. ''Sidebar,'' by Adam Liptak.
PAGE A12

Halt Ordered to Baghdad Wall After criticism from both Sunni Arab and Shiite parties, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki of Iraq ordered a halt to construction of a wall around a Sunni neighborhood in Baghdad, saying it reminded people of ''other walls.''
PAGE A6
Plan for a Greener New York In a plan to create ''the first environmentally sustainable 21st-century city,'' Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg proposed 127 projects, regulations and innovations.
PAGE B1
Specter Critical of Gonzales Senator Arlen Specter, top Republican on the Judiciary Committee, said Attorney General Alberto R. Gonzales's presence was ''bad for the Justice Department.''
PAGE A14
Push for Legal Gay Marriage Gov. Eliot Spitzer is expected to introduce a bill to legalize same-sex marriage in New York, propelling the state to the forefront of a politically contentious issue.
